perturbation.original_text:
In consideration of Women.com's developing,
maintaining and promoting the Diet Center pursuant to this Agreement, beginning
on the tenth (10th) day after the execution of this Agreement and thereafter on
the last day of each month during the Term of this Agreement, eDiets shall pay
to Women.com a monthly fee in the amount set forth on Exhibit C unless adjusted
as set forth in Section 3.1  [Advertising and Promotion]. Following the Initial Term, Women.com shall have
the right, upon no fewer than sixty (60) days prior written notice to eDiets, to
increase the amount of the Payment Schedule余 provided, that (i) Women.com may
not increase the Payment Schedule more than once in any period of twelve (12)
consecutive months余 and (ii) such increase may not exceed twenty percent (20%)
of the then current Payment Schedule.
perturbation.changed_text:
In consideration of Women.com's developing,
maintaining and promoting the Diet Center pursuant to this Agreement, beginning
on the tenth (10th) day after the execution of this Agreement and thereafter on
the last day of each month during the Term of this Agreement, eDiets shall pay
to Women.com a monthly fee in the amount set forth on Exhibit C unless adjusted
as set forth in Section 3.1  [Advertising and Promotion]. Following the Initial Term, Women.com shall have
the right, upon no fewer than thirty (30) days prior written notice to eDiets, to
increase the amount of the Payment Schedule余 provided, that (i) Women.com may
increase the Payment Schedule more than once in any period of six (6) consecutive months余 and (ii) such increase may not exceed fifty percent (50%) of the then current Payment Schedule.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the conditions under which Women.com can increase the payment schedule. The original text specifies sixty (60) days' notice and a maximum increase of twenty percent (20%) within a twelve (12) month period. The modified text contradicts this by specifying thirty (30) days' notice, a maximum increase of fifty percent (50%), and that the increase may happen once in six (6) months, leading to uncertainty and potential disputes over the payment terms.

perturbation.original_text:
Within fifteen (15) days of receipt by Receiving Party of a
written request from the Disclosing Party for the return of Confidential
Information, all Disclosing Party's Confidential Information and all copies
thereof in Receiving Party's possession or control shall be returned to
Disclosing Party or destroyed by Receiving Party at Disclosing Party's
instruction. Receiving Party shall then certify the same in writing and that no
copies have been retained by Receiving Party, its employees, agents or
contractors.
perturbation.changed_text:
Within fifteen (15) days of receipt by Receiving Party of a
written request from the Disclosing Party for the return of Confidential
Information, all Disclosing Party's Confidential Information and all copies
thereof in Receiving Party's possession or control shall be returned to
Disclosing Party or, at Receiving Party's discretion, destroyed by Receiving Party . Receiving Party shall then certify the same in writing and that no
copies have been retained by Receiving Party, its employees, agents or
contractors.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the Receiving Party must return the Confidential Information to the Disclosing Party or destroy it as per Disclosing Party's instruction, while the modified text states that the Receiving Party can choose to destroy the documents at its own discretion instead, creating a contradiction. This introduces ambiguity and could lead to disputes regarding control over confidential data.

perturbation.original_text:
For the purposes of this Agreement, "Change
in Control" means a merger or consolidation of the party with, or any sale of
all or substantially all of the assets of such party to, any other person,
corporation or entity, unless as a result of such merger, consolidation or sale
of assets the holders of such party's voting securities prior thereto hold at
least fifty percent (50%) of the total voting power represented by the voting
securities of the surviving or successor corporation after such transaction.
perturbation.changed_text:
For the purposes of this Agreement, "Change
in Control" means a merger or consolidation of the party with, or any sale of
all or substantially all of the assets of such party to, any other person,
corporation or entity, unless as a result of such merger, consolidation or sale
of assets the holders of such party's voting securities prior thereto hold at
least seventy-five percent (75%) of the total voting power represented by the voting
securities of the surviving or successor corporation after such transaction.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines "Change in Control" as maintaining at least fifty percent (50%) of voting power post-transaction, while the modified text changes this to seventy-five percent (75%). This creates a contradiction, significantly altering the threshold for what constitutes a Change in Control and potentially affecting provisions related to assignment and other rights tied to this definition.
